title: Awesome List Updates on Jan 15, 2022

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Third-Party owned

*   [Riseup](https://riseup.net/en/about-us) - Online communication tools for people and groups working on liberatory social change.

### Email Alias Services (Anonymous Forwarding)

*   [SimpleLogin (⭐5.8k)](https://github.com/simple-login/app)
*   [AnonAddy (⭐3.9k)](https://github.com/anonaddy/anonaddy)
items.content_html:
Third-Party owned

  • Riseup - Online communication tools for people and groups working on liberatory social change.

Email Alias Services (Anonymous Forwarding)

  • SimpleLogin (⭐5.8k)
  • AnonAddy (⭐3.9k)

items.title: Awesome Nodered
items.content_text:
### Installation

*   [Home Assistant Community Add-on](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/home-assistant-community-add-on-node-red/55023) - Starts an instance within Home Assistant and communicates with it.
*   [ioBroker node-red Adapter (⭐51)](https://github.com/ioBroker/ioBroker.node-red) - Starts an instance within ioBroker and communicates with it.
*   [RedMatic (⭐538)](https://github.com/rdmtc/RedMatic/wiki/Installation) - Install Node-RED on a CCU3, smart home automation hardware from the manufacturer eQ-3, popular especially in Germany.

### Nodes / UI

*   [iglass](https://www.npmjs.com/package/iglass-nodes) - Interaction with [iGlass Automation](https://iglass.international) blocks.
items.content_html:
Installation

  • Home Assistant Community Add-on - Starts an instance within Home Assistant and communicates with it.
  • ioBroker node-red Adapter (⭐51) - Starts an instance within ioBroker and communicates with it.
  • RedMatic (⭐538) - Install Node-RED on a CCU3, smart home automation hardware from the manufacturer eQ-3, popular especially in Germany.

Nodes / UI

  • iglass - Interaction with iGlass Automation blocks.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [ipfs-pinner (⭐58)](https://github.com/wabarc/ipfs-pinner): A toolkit helps upload files to IPFS pinning services such as Infura, Pinata, NFT.Storage and Web3.Storage.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • ipfs-pinner (⭐58): A toolkit helps upload files to IPFS pinning services such as Infura, Pinata, NFT.Storage and Web3.Storage.

items.title: Awesome Deep Learning
items.content_text:
### Table of Contents / Courses

*   [Yann LeCun’s Deep Learning Course at CDS](https://cds.nyu.edu/deep-learning/) - DS-GA 1008 · SPRING 2021
*   [Neural Networks and Deep Learning](https://webcms3.cse.unsw.edu.au/COMP9444/19T3/) - COMP9444 19T3

### Table of Contents / Papers

*   [VOLO: Vision Outlooker for Visual Recognition](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2106.13112.pdf)
*   [ViT: An Image is Worth 16x16 Words: Transformers for Image Recognition at Scale](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2010.11929.pdf)
items.content_html:
Table of Contents / Courses

  • Yann LeCun’s Deep Learning Course at CDS - DS-GA 1008 · SPRING 2021
  • Neural Networks and Deep Learning - COMP9444 19T3

Table of Contents / Papers

  • VOLO: Vision Outlooker for Visual Recognition
  • ViT: An Image is Worth 16x16 Words: Transformers for Image Recognition at Scale

items.title: Awesome Json
items.content_text:
### Command-line tools

*   [dsq (⭐3.8k)](https://github.com/multiprocessio/dsq) - Tool for running SQL queries against JSON, CSV, Excel, Parquet, and more.
items.content_html:
Command-line tools

  • dsq (⭐3.8k) - Tool for running SQL queries against JSON, CSV, Excel, Parquet, and more.

items.title: Dive Into Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Deep Learning / Easier sharing of deep learning models and demos

*   **[*Deep Learning*](https://www.deeplearningbook.org/), a free book published MIT Press.** By Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville.
    *   A notable testimonial for it is here: ["What are the best ways to pick up Deep Learning skills as an engineer?"](https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-best-ways-to-pick-up-Deep-Learning-skills-as-an-engineer)
items.content_html:
Deep Learning / Easier sharing of deep learning models and demos

  • Deep Learning, a free book published MIT Press. By Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville.
    • A notable testimonial for it is here: "What are the best ways to pick up Deep Learning skills as an engineer?"
